clinical_study.brief_title: Use of MgSO4 for Pain After Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Use of MgSO4 Reduced Opioid Consumption for Pain After Sleeve Gastrectomy Operations: A Prospective Randomized Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of magnesium sulfate on pain management for pain after sleeve gastrectomy operation

detailed_description.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to investigate the effect of magnesium sulfate on pain management for pain after sleeve gastrectomy operation.
Design: A prospective, randomized, controlled clinical study.
Setting: University hospital.
Participants: Eighty patients undergoing sleeve gastrectomy.
Measurements and Main Results: Visual analog scale for pain score, sedation score, mean arterial pressure, heart rate, and valid and invalid analgesic demand will record. Serum magnesium levels will determined at preoperative evaluation, postanesthesia care unit admission and at 24 hours. Side effects will also record.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: A Patient, investigator and anesthesiologist who was blinded to the assignment of the patients recorded levels of sedation, pain, cumulative morphine consumption, and hemodynamic variables

primary_outcome.measure: Item pain intensity measure assessed by using VAS scores
primary_outcome.description: Pain was assessed by using VAS scores (0: no pain and 10: worst pain) imaginable recorded at 0, 1, 2, 4, 6, 24, and 24 hours.

arm_group.description: The magnesium group (group Mg, n _ 40) received an additional infusion of MgSO4 (30 mg/kg by bolus and 10 mg/kg/h by infusion for 24 hours)
the control group (group C, n _ 40) received the same amount of IV saline

intervention.description: The magnesium group (group Mg, n _ 40) received an additional infusion of MgSO4

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 to 65 year old individuals who underwent laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- One or more of the following: cardio - vascular and respiratory diseases, drug and/or alcohol abuse, use of daily an algesia 24 hours before the surgery, renal failure, and liver dysfunction.
